page.title: 04Wild Flowers in Chadderton
page.content: We found some derelict buildings and loads of Rosebay Willowherb which has a pink flower. Everywhere you go you find stinging nettles. When you walk along the streets you find Lady's Smock. The common name is Cuckoo Flower. It grows out of the cracks in the pavement. On the Golf Links there were four different flowers found, Coltsfoot, Meadow Buttercup, Clover and Daisy. In gardens there are always weeds. One weed that is hard to get rid of is Dandelion. There is a river in our area and near that Field Horsetail can be found.
